subsc: Other social services,Health,Compulsory pension and unemployment insurance

abstracts.cdata!:
The Social Sector Adjustment Credit
            Project seeks to support the governments of the union of
            Serbia and Montenegro - and its largest constituent member
            state, Serbia - in implementing reforms in social
            protection, labor, and health given these are more fiscally
            sustainable, but continuing to provide as well, core
            benefits, and services to the population, in particular the
            poorest. The main objectives are to a) reduce short, and
            medium term fiscal pressures from social programs, through a
            combination of entitlement reform, and efficiency
            improvements; and, b) maximize the poverty alleviation
            impact of a given level of public spending, through improved
            targeting of, and sustained access for the poor to services.
            The subsidiary objective of the operation would be improved
            transparency, and accountability in the management of public
            funds in social programs, and monitoring of their impact.
